decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost instants and creatures with prowess abilities. By utilizing spells like Reckless Rage and Monstrous Rage, along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, the deck aims to control the board and apply pressure early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Boomerang Basics and Den of the Bugbear to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain tempo. Overall, the deck focuses on fast-paced aggression and efficient use of spells to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea behind this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, and powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck also aims to gain advantage with cards like Gifted Aetherborn and Preacher of the Schism, while utilizing lands like Mutavault and Godless Shrine to ensure consistency in mana production. Overall, the focus is on resource management and disruption to outlast and outplay the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to maintain control over the battlefield and pressure the opponent. By utilizing powerful creatures like Nashi and Cecil, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Thoughtseize and Duress helps to strip the opponent of key cards, while cards like Jace Reawakened and Valki, God of Lies provide additional utility and card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of different lands to ensure consistent mana production.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of burn spells and efficient creatures. The key strategy is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with cheap, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while utilizing burn spells like Reckless Rage and Torch the Tower to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing to ensure that it can maintain pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

Fast and efficient casting of spells to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and cast them for free, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells and disrupting their hand with Picklock Prankster. Utilizing card draw spells like Opt and Consider to find the needed pieces and keep the engine going, with Treasure Cruise to refill the hand. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo throughout the game, utilizing the powerful synergy between Arclight Phoenix and cheap spells to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Lotus Field and various ramp cards to quickly generate a large amount of mana and then win the game through a combo involving Scapeshift, Thassa's Oracle, and potentially other cards like Mirrorpool or Otawara, Soaring City. The deck aims to achieve a powerful mana advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and decisive win condition, primarily centered around utilizing the synergy between Lotus Field and other cards in the deck.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Emberheart Challenger. Using powerful sorceries like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to control the board and experimental artifacts like Cori-Steel Cutter and Stormchaser's Talent to enhance your creatures. The deck aims to maintain a fast-paced, in-your-face strategy to pressure the opponent early and often, while utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to finish off any remaining threats.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with cheap, aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage, Emberheart Challenger, and Monastery Swiftspear. By using efficient spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, along with versatile cards like Stormchaser's Talent, the deck aims to control the board while delivering fast damage to the opponent. The mana base is streamlined with a mix of lands that can come into play untapped, allowing for a quick start and ensuring consistent aggression throughout the game.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to stall the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Using cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Dovin's Veto, the deck aims to control the board while slowly building up its own resources. The presence of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional synergy and value for the deck. By maintaining a defensive stance and controlling the pace of the game, this deck looks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantages.

The main focus of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells and then bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards like Ledger Shredder and Fiery Impulse to help fill the graveyard, as well as spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to draw additional cards. With a mix of spells and creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays while utilizing the powerful ability of Arclight Phoenix to rapidly bring it back to the battlefield.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Emberheart Challenger, Monastery Swiftspear, and Soul-Scar Mage, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Academic Dispute and Stormchaser's Talent helps to maintain card advantage and pump up the deck's creatures. Overall, this deck is designed to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The goal of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with small creatures and efficient removal spells to overwhelm the opponent. By maximizing the use of low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Ornithopter, combined with powerful pump spells like Venerated Loxodon, the deck aims to end the game quickly before the opponent can build up their defenses. The inclusion of cards like Portable Hole and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben also disrupt the opponent's strategy, allowing the aggro deck to maintain its aggressive momentum.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and outpace the opponent by utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By deploying multiple threats early on and consistently applying pressure, the deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, and Stormchaser's Talent helps to ensure a fast and aggressive game plan, while cards like Boomerang Basics and Reckless Rage provide additional removal and tempo advantage.

The key theme of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to efficiently ramp into powerful creatures and disruptive spells while overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. Utilizing cards like Collected Company and Llanowar Elves to quickly develop a board presence, alongside disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes finishers like Archon of Emeria and Elspeth, Storm Slayer to close out the game swiftly. Overall, the deck focuses on early aggression and disruption to quickly overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures with abilities that deal damage to the opponent, while also including spells that can target the opponent directly. By utilizing a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes some land cards that provide flexibility in terms of mana production. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive play and efficient use of resources.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field along with various land ramp spells to quickly generate a large amount of mana. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible, allowing for explosive plays such as casting multiple high-cost spells in a single turn or activating powerful abilities multiple times. The deck also includes some protection and recursion elements to ensure resilience against disruption from the opponent. Overall, the main objective is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of resources and threats, leading to a swift victory.
